entries.meaning: (uncountable, agriculture, veterinary medicine) A fatal cattle disease caused by the soil-borne bacterium Clostridium chauvoei; symptomatic anthrax. [from 18th c.]
(countable) A person who cheats in a game; a cheater, especially a dishonest bookmaker. [from 18th c.]
examples: They have no regard for respectability like yours — nothing between a baron and a blackleg.

entries.meaning: (countable) A person who takes the place of striking workers; a scab. [from 19th c.]

verbs.description: blackleg (third-person singular simple present blacklegs, present participle blacklegging, simple past and past participle blacklegged)

entries.meaning: To continue working whilst fellow workers strike.
examples: Why was I there, munitioning, blacklegging, slaving as though my bread depended on it?
